page.title: 12Housing
page.content: The part of Medbourne included in this block has a majority of old stone houses and cottages mostly owner occupied. The few modern houses and bungalows have been blended into the overall scene due to the strict control of planning regulations in this conservation area. There are twenty eight council houses and a few of these have been purchased by their tenants. Drayton is a mixture of old and new, again mostly owner occupied. There are sixteen council houses. Nevill Holt consists of only seven houses all owned by the Phillips Family, owners of the school, and occupied by their employees. There are a number of outlying farms and cottages but new building is restricted to infilling in the villages except for agricultural needs
